questions.question: Which sentence contains an incorrect use of a verb?

options.B: He suggested to go for a walk.

questions.explanation: 'Suggested' should be followed by a gerund, so the correct sentence is 'He suggested going for a walk.'

questions.question: Which sentence has the correct verb form?

options.A: She has went to the market.
options.B: She has gone to the market.
options.C: She have gone to the market.

questions.explanation: 'Gone' is the correct past participle of 'go' and follows 'has'.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences has a **subject-verb agreement error**?

options.A: Neither of the boys is ready.
options.B: Each of the students has a textbook.
options.C: The committee were divided in their opinions.
options.D: My dog and cat loves to play together.

questions.explanation: 'Dog and cat' is plural, so it should be 'love' instead of 'loves.'

questions.question: Which sentence has a **modal verb error**?

options.A: You must finish your homework before going out.
options.B: She should to study harder for the exam.
options.C: We might go to the concert tonight.
options.D: Can you help me with this task?

questions.explanation: 'Should' is a modal verb and should not be followed by 'to'; correct form: 'She should study harder.'

questions.question: Which of the following uses **passive voice correctly**?

options.A: The letter was wrote by Sarah.
options.B: The letter was written by Sarah.

questions.explanation: Passive voice follows: 'be + past participle'; correct form: 'was written'.

questions.question: Identify the **incorrect** use of past tense.

options.B: She seen the movie last night.
options.D: We met at the café yesterday.

questions.explanation: 'Seen' is the past participle and requires 'have' (e.g., 'She has seen'). The correct sentence is 'She saw the movie last night.'

questions.question: Which of the following sentences contains a **conditional tense error**?

options.A: If I were you, I would apologize.
options.B: If he studied more, he will pass.
options.C: If it rains, we will stay inside.
options.D: If she had worked harder, she would have succeeded.

questions.explanation: The correct structure is 'If he studied more, he would pass' (Second Conditional).

questions.question: Which sentence has the **wrong participle form**?

options.A: Having finished his homework, he went outside to play.
options.C: The stolen car was found near the highway.

questions.explanation: 'Boring' should be 'bored'. Correct sentence: 'She is bored in class.'

questions.question: Which sentence has an **error in reported speech**?

options.A: She said she would call me later.
options.B: He asked if I could help him.
options.C: She told me she will arrive soon.
options.D: They said they had finished their work.

questions.explanation: In reported speech, 'will' changes to 'would'. Correct sentence: 'She told me she would arrive soon.'

questions.question: Which sentence contains a **gerund usage error**?

options.A: She enjoys swimming in the ocean.
options.C: They suggested to go to the park.
options.D: I don’t mind waiting for a few minutes.

questions.explanation: 'Suggested' should be followed by a gerund. Correct form: 'They suggested going to the park.'

questions.question: Which of the following sentences is grammatically incorrect?

options.A: He let me borrow his bike.
options.C: I saw him leaving the office.

questions.explanation: 'Made' is followed by the base form of the verb. Correct sentence: 'She made me cry.'

questions.question: Which of the following has an **incorrect tense usage**?

options.A: She has lived here for five years.
options.B: I had finished my homework before they arrived.
options.C: He is eating lunch when I called him.
options.D: They will visit us next weekend.

questions.explanation: Correct past continuous form: 'He was eating lunch when I called him.'

questions.question: Which sentence has a **wrong infinitive form**?

options.C: I hope to see you soon.

questions.explanation: 'Made' does not take 'to'; correct sentence: 'She made me laugh.'

questions.question: Which sentence uses **incorrect passive voice**?

options.A: The book was written by a famous author.
options.B: The window was broke by the storm.
options.C: The project was completed on time.

questions.explanation: The correct past participle is 'broken': 'The window was broken by the storm.'

questions.question: Which sentence contains an incorrect form of **phrasal verb**?

options.A: She looked after her younger brother.
options.B: He ran into his old friend at the mall.
options.D: I am looking forward to meet you.

questions.explanation: Correct form: 'I am looking forward to meeting you.'
